intro_text:
DEADLINE
By Marc Blank

You are the Chief of Detectives. You've been summoned to the Robner estate to investigate the death of Mr. Marshall Robner, a wealthy industrialist. He was found dead in his locked bedroom this morning, apparently from an overdose of his prescribed sleeping medication.

The coroner has ruled it a suicide, but Mrs. Robner is not convinced. She has asked you to investigate further. You have 12 hours before the case will be officially closed.

The estate is large and the family members all seem to have their own secrets. You'll need to examine evidence carefully, question everyone, and piece together what really happened last night.

Good luck, Inspector. Time is running out.
victory_text:
CASE SOLVED!

Congratulations! Through careful investigation and deduction, you have successfully proven that George Robner murdered his father with the assistance of Ms. Dunbar.

George, facing disinheritance and crushing gambling debts, conspired with Ms. Dunbar (who was having an affair with him) to kill Marshall Robner. They used an overdose of Ebullion mixed with Ms. Dunbar's LoBlo medication to ensure a fatal reaction, then staged the scene to look like suicide.

The ladder from the shed was used to access the library balcony after the murder, where they planted the fake suicide note. The mud on the ladder and in the library, along with the damaged roses, provided the crucial physical evidence.

Both George Robner and Ms. Dunbar have been arrested and will stand trial for murder.

Your keen investigative skills have brought justice for Marshall Robner.
failure_text:
CASE UNSOLVED

Unfortunately, you have failed to solve the case in time. Without sufficient evidence to prove murder, the death of Marshall Robner will remain officially listed as a suicide.

The real killer has escaped justice, and the truth may never be known.

Perhaps if you had been more thorough in your investigation, or questioned the suspects more carefully, you might have uncovered the evidence needed to solve this case.
timeout_text:
TIME'S UP

Your 12 hours have expired. The case is being closed as a suicide, as originally determined by the coroner.

You suspect there's more to the story - the inconsistencies in the evidence, the nervous behavior of certain family members, the mysterious circumstances - but without concrete proof, there's nothing more you can do.

The investigation is over. The truth will remain buried with Marshall Robner.
